SEARCH
Package edu.kit.unwwi.checkpoints.qmp

Klasse QMPInterface

java.lang.Object
edu.kit.unwwi.checkpoints.qmp.QMPInterface
public class QMPInterface extends Object
The class representing the connection to the QMP server. Sends requests and handles all incoming data, including asynchronous events which may occur. For this, it uses a pure socket which uses Telnet to communicate with the host.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • QMPInterface

      public QMPInterface(@NotNull @NotNull String host, int port) throws IOException
      Parameter:
      host - The host where the QMP server runs. Is probably localhost in most cases.
      port - The port the host listens on.
      Löst aus:
      IOException - When the connection couldn't be established.

  • Methodendetails

    • executeCommand

      public void executeCommand(@NotNull @NotNull Command command) throws IOException
      Execute the given command. The command itself will contain the result once this method finishes executing. This method itself doesn't check for errors in the data, that's up to the implementation of a command.
      Parameter:
      command - The command to execute.
      Löst aus:
      IOException - When something went wrong during transmission.

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Informs this Interface to shut down. Calling this method will lead this interface to kill the connections, no matter what kind of data is being transmitted.

    • registerEventHandler

      public void registerEventHandler(@NotNull @NotNull EventHandler handler)
      Add a handler which receives specific asynchronous events from the QEMU-instance.
      Parameter:
      handler - The receiving handler.

    • unregisterEventHandler

      public void unregisterEventHandler(@NotNull @NotNull EventHandler handler)
      Remove a previously added handler from this QEMU-instance.
      Parameter:
      handler - The handler to remove.
